intro: Carduus reuterianus var. subacanthoides, commonly known as the spiked sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has rough, serrated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it identifiable and distinguishable from other similar species within the genus Carduus.
